source_info: The blueprint for the Memory Resonator is obtained as a reward for reaching Anchor Point 1 in the Expedition 7: Leviathan.
release_history: * Outlaws - Introduced as part of Expedition 7: Leviathan.

title: Mineral Processing Rig
summary: Mineral Processing Rig provides Large Refiner capabilities to the Colossus.
game_description:
A large and powerful refiner unit, designed to be housed within the belly of a Colossus Exocraft.

The unit is able to process the most complex recipes, but requires its own independent fuel source.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.

title: Minotaur AI Pilot
summary:
Minotaur AI Pilot is a technology allowing semi-autonomous Minotaur operations.

While the game description says it can "engage in mining activities", this feature has yet to be implemented.
game_description:
A semi-autonomous artificial pilot plugin for the Minotaur Heavy Exocraft Hybrid. Installation allows the Minotaur to traverse planets itself and engage in combat or mining activities to support its primary operator.

The AI pilot will always cede control to the primary operator when they enter the cockpit.

Piloting routines are highly localised. It is incapable of developing emotional bonds nor exercising independent control of the Minotaur.
use_info:
When active, it will auto-pilot the Minotaur and it will follow the player. If the player encounters any danger such as the Sentinel or Biological Horror, the Minotaur will fight alongside the player, providing the AI is turned on and the Minotaur have at least one weapon installed. The AI can be turned off in the Quick Menu However, take note that if it took too much damage, its technology will be destroyed, which requires repair. 

Initially, the enemy will ignore the Minotaur even if it is fighting. However if the enemy was being attacked by the mech then it will strike back. If the autopilot AI was damaged, it will results in a message AI Autopilot Critically Damaged. Additionally, unless manual control were established, if the AI was damaged, it will stop fighting or following the player. If the engine were damaged, then feature is also disabled even if manual control were established, and will results in a message saying Exocraft fuel is below <20% (for unknown reasons).
release_history: *SentinelUp - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
thumb|A Player Minotaur's Technology Bar, with a Visible adjacency Bonus Border visible on both the Body and the AI Pilot.
The Minotaur AI Pilot can be disabled when on foot but not inside minotaur, by going to the cog on the left in the quickmenu. The menu item is two to the right from the flashlight item.

The Hardframe Body also adds the same AI Feature to the Minotaur. Installing both, the Body and this component, allows for the AI to continue functioning until both Components (or the Engine) are damaged, allowing the AI to remain active for longer whilst in combat.

* This may also cause more components to get damaged during battle, as the AI doesn't stop if components other than the Engine or the AI sources are damaged.
* The Body, the Liquidator Body and this Component have adjacency bonuses, but what these do exactly is unknown.

title: Minotaur Bore
summary: Minotaur Bore provides Terrain Manipulator capabilities to the Minotaur Laser. It is, however, not very fuel-efficient. You refuel it with Carbon, Condensed Carbon, or Oxygen; so bring or harvest plenty.
game_description:
Adds Terrain Manipulation capability to the laser array of the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

A special mount allows the rapid deployment of a high-energy terrain excavator, without clogging the Minotaur's delicate joints and servos with dirt.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Minotaur Cannon
summary: Minotaur Cannon is a Minotaur weapon which lobs explosives toward targets. It shoots two explosives per second and must periodically be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit).
game_description:
A mounted cannon specifically designed for the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

Designed primarily for damage against biological entities and inefficient when deployed as a mining device.
release_history: *ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Minotaur Geobay
summary:
Minotaur Geobay is used to provide a safe parking lot for the Minotaur Exocraft.

Geobays can be placed anywhere, inside or outside of a claimed base. When a geobay is destroyed, the resources used to build it are returned.

All geobays have two terminals. One terminal, with a blue screen, is used to respawn the geobay's Exocraft; the other terminal, with an orange screen, grants access to Exocraft customisation.
game_description:
A secure parking, summoning and customisation facility for the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

Deploy the Minotaur from the Quick Menu. With the aid of an Orbital Exocraft Materialiser mounted inside a freighter, the Minotaur can be instantly deployed to any location within the same system as the mothership.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Geobays can now be used to customise their respective Exocraft.
* Expeditions - blueprint formula changed, Gold is now used instead of Paraffinium.

title: Minotaur Laser
summary: The Minotaur Laser is a weapon which can be mounted on a Minotaur.
game_description:
A mounted laser system specifically designed for the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

Enables conventional mining operations. Ineffective in combat scenarios.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Minotaur Radar Array
summary: Minotaur Radar Array is a scanner technology upgrade for Minotaur.
game_description:
A high-detail radar device, capable of upgrading the scanner technology aboard the Minotaur to Analysis Visor levels.

Press File:Key.c.png to activate a radar sweep, revealing additional points of interest that cannot be located via a Multi-tool scanner.

Use the Quick Menu to tune the radar to specific buildings.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Mounted Cannon
summary:
Mounted Cannon is an exocraft weapon which lobs explosives toward targets and can be mounted on any exocraft. It shoots two explosives per second and must periodically be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit).

It has a dedicated Upgrade Module type, Exocraft Cannon Module. Upgrades from these modules grant significant improvements to the weapon's damage, rate of fire and charge efficiency.

*
game_description: Due to energy requirements of this powerful weapon, they can only be fired from an Exocraft mount.
additional_info: *Each shot deals 1040 damage to a permadeath save file.

title: Mounted Flamethrower
summary: Mounted Flamethrower provides Flamethrower capabilities to all Exocrafts.
game_description:
A mounted flamethrower specifically designed for the Exocraft.
Causes Extreme damage at close range Use G to cycle through available weapon modes
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.

title: Movement System Upgrade
summary: Movement System Upgrades, contained within Movement Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the movement functions of the Exosuit.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Beyond - The indication of the Fuel Efficiency is changed to the minus sign (-), previously it used the plus sign (+).
additional_info: * Upgrade bonuses trigger for Movement System Upgrades if they are adjacent to Jetpack,

title: Multi-Tool Expansion Slot
summary:
Multi-Tool Expansion Slot is a curiosity.

It provides a one-slot upgrade.
game_description: A flexible upgrade circuit, compatible with all person
source_info:
* Can be chosen as a reward after completing a Manufacturing Facility's puzzle. (100%)
* From Crashed Freighter containers (4%)
* Pirate Missionboard (3%)
* Nexus Missions (2%)
* Buried Cache (2%)
* Mission Board (1%)
* Rare reward when interacting with NPCs (0.7%)
* When opening Suspicious Packet (Goods) (0.3%)
release_history:
* Expeditions - Value changed, was 95,000.
* Waypoint - Icon changed.
additional_info:
* It can be exchanged at the Multi-Tool Upgrade Station to increase Multi-Tool inventory size by one slot.
* Sources have been extracted from the 3.99.1 version of the REWARDTABLE.MBIN game file. The chances have been calculated based on the weights in that file.

title: Multi-Tool Upgrades
summary: The multi-tool is the hand-held multipurpose tool / gun that the player is given in No Man's Sky. The following upgrades are available:

title: Multi-Tool Upgrades (Atlas)
summary: The multi-tool is the hand-held multipurpose tool / gun that the player is given in No Man's Sky. The following upgrades are available:

title: Myth Beacon
summary: Myth Beacon is a curiosity acquired and used during Expedition 2: Beachhead.
game_description:
The result of Nada's research into unusual patterns detected in the stories of the Gek, Korvax, and Vy'keen.

The beacon broadcasts a signal echo attuned to the shift historiographical flux mapped by Nada's traveller companions.

Specialist Polo is unwilling to predict the results of the broadcast.
source_info: Awarded after reaching Rendezvous 5 during the Beachhead expedition. it is necessary to complete the Historiography Lesson.  After acquiring the Historiographical Dosimeter, interact with three plaques or monoliths, and select "Take dosimeter reading for Nada". Once three readings are collected and the award is unlocked, then proceed to the Space Anomaly and it will be possible to redeem 80 Quicksilver from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion to obtain a Myth Beacon.
use_info: The Myth Beacon must be used to complete Echo Through the Ages task in the Beachhead expedition.  This is done by reaching the Boundary Failure at latitude/longitude +60.78, +119.42 on Nessie Q8 and deploying the Myth Beacon.
release_history: * Beachhead Expedition - Added as a curiosity.

title: Nautilon Cannon
summary:
Nautilon Cannon is an exocraft weapon for the Nautilon.

The weapon draws from an internal fuel supply to lob explosive projectiles which are affected by gravity. This fuel supply can be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit). Each shot drains 0.75% fuel when fired, and the weapon has a default fire rate of 2 shots per second, resulting in a default fuel drain rate of 1.5%/sec during continuous fire.

It has a dedicated Upgrade Module type, Nautilon Cannon Module. Upgrades from these modules may grant significant improvements to damage and rate of fire.
game_description:
A mounted cannon specifically designed for the Nautilon Submarine.

A high-energy weapon system, it superheats a small body of water before launching it rapidly towards the intended target.

Designed primarily for damage against biological entities and inefficient when deployed as a mining device.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant located on space stations for ?
additional_info: For any save editors that want to increase the actual fire rate of the cannon, duplicate copies of the Exocraft Mounted Cannon in the same exocraft increase the rate of fire indirectly due to an adjacency glitch similar to that of the Photon Cannon and Spewing Vents.

title: Neural Shielding
summary: Neural Shielding is a Living Ship technology and allows blocking of hostile cargo probes.
game_description:
A beautiful living weave of nanotubes, laced through the vessel's neural assembly. This structure can be energised as the ship deems fit, creating a field that blocks hostile cargo probes.

Use the Quick Menu while a scan is in progress to ask that the ship might block the scan.
source_info: Neural Shielding is grown from Neural Shielding Implant.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info: Neural Shielding has the same icon as Fragile Neural Stem.

title: Neural Shielding Implant
summary: Neural Shielding Implant is a Living Ship technology and can evolve into Neural Shielding which allows blocking of hostile cargo probes.
game_description: A pre-grown bionic implant, designed to facilitate the fusion of bio-technology to sentient starships. Use
source_info: Grown from Psychonic Egg.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info: Neural Shielding Implant has the same icon as Fragile Shell.

title: Neural Stimulator
summary:
Neural Stimulator is a technology that allows a player to fire their jetpack longer and to run a greater distance.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description: Increases the capacity of the Exosuit's Jetpack Tanks and Adrenal Pump Reserves, allowing the user to both fly and sprint longer.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly for 90
release_history: *NEXT - Added as a technology.
additional_info: *Upgrade bonuses trigger if Neural Stimulator is adjacent to

infobox.stats:
+20% Jetpack Tanks
+10% Sprint Distance
+11% Recharge Rate
+21% Sprint Recovery Time

title: Neutron Shielding
summary: Neutron Shielding is a hazard protection upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description:
Highly-efficient control materials are inserted into the frame of the Exocraft, neutralising dangerous incoming energy waves.

Entirely prevents all damage or energy drain while inside an Exocraft in radioactive environments.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology

title: Nonlinear Optics
summary: Nonlinear Optics is technology that augments the Photon Cannon, a starship weapon. Its effects stack with those provided by Photon Cannon Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades.
game_description:
Replaces the conventional Photon Cannon optics with an experimental glass array, boosting combat performance.

Significantly improves heat sink capacity.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed,previously used Cobalt Mirror and Technology Module was renamed to Wiring Loom.

title: Nutrient Ingestor
summary: Nutrient Ingestor is an Exosuit technology that improves exosuit performance by ingesting cooked items.
game_description:
The nutrient ingestor improves exosuit performance via the automatic portioning and processing of various cooked items.

Select Begin Ingestion to commence automatic consumption of supplied ingredients.
source_info: This blueprint can be bought from the Exosuit upgrade merchant on the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.

title: Obsolete Technology
summary: Obsolete Technology is a technology that replaced the outdated exosuit and starship Sigma/Tau/Theta type technologies, which were removed in NEXT.
game_description:
A piece of technology, corrupted by interference from the Atlas.

Can be recycled for usable components.
release_history: * NEXT 1.51 - It also rewards the player with Nanite Cluster (beside Technology Module), when dismantling.

title: Optical Drill
summary: The Optical Drill is a Multi-tool upgrade for the Mining Laser, allowing for more resources to be collected per click.
game_description:
Wafer-thin lens arrays are arranged in a highly calibrated matrix, focusing the Mining Beam on an atomic level.

This extra precision allows for highly efficient mining. Elements are extracted more efficiently, increasing the yield from items harvested with the Multi-Tool.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Eos in the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Aquarius 5.12 - Added back into the tech tree.
additional_info: Installing the Optical Drill will also increase the amount harvested from plants by 50%, with an extra 6% bonus from each connected mining laser module. If you surround the Optical drill on all four sides it ends up giving a bonus of 74%.

title: Osmotic Generator
summary: Osmotic Generator is a propulsion upgrade for the Nautilon submarine. It lowers the fuel drain of all movement within the Exocraft, extending the distance it can cover before the Humboldt Drive requires recharge with a Hydrothermal Fuel Cell.
game_description:
Installed into the drive system aboard the Nautilon Submarine.

Captures energy by exploiting the saline gradient in deep water environments, allowing a slow recharge of the Humboldt Drive in the event of fuel emergencies.
release_history:
* Abyss - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Chloride Lattice
additional_info:
*Osmotic Generator triggers Upgrade bonuses when installed adjacent to the Humboldt Drive or any of its procedurally generated upgrades, further increasing fuel efficiency. 
*It does not actually allow recharge of the Nautilon, instead it simply reduces fuel burn.

title: P-Field Compressor
summary:
P-Field Compressor is a technology that augments the Neutron Cannon, a Multi-tool weapon. Its effects stack with those provided by Neutron Cannon Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades. Supercharging its unique +2.0 spheres stat provides more per-shot damage than supercharging an S-rank upgrade, though less charge speed.

The blueprint can be purchased from Iteration: Eos for 180
game_description:
A powerful upgrade to the Neutron Cannon. Additional resonance compressors allow significantly more energy to be routed through the cannon's central core, dramatically increasing operating power.

Installation will allow a fully-charged Neutron Cannon to launch additional projectiles at higher speeds.
release_history: * SentinelUp - Added as a technology.

title: Personal Forcefield
summary: Personal Forcefield is a technology which adds a deployable shield as an alt-fire function to Multi-tool weapons. This shield nullifies all ranged attacks coming from the front, but disables weapon usage (except in virtual reality; see Additional Information) and incurs a heavy drain on Life Support while active (the percentage value associated with the shield in the heads-up display indicates how much Life Support is left).
game_description:
On activation, this module draws power from Exosuit Life Support systems to overload the Multi-Tool, distorting the electromagnetic field around the user and creating a powerful personal shield.

While this field offers substantial protection against incoming laser fire, the user is advised that the Multi-Tool cannot be used for other functions while powering the shield.
release_history: * NEXT 1.57 - Fixed an issue where it could be deployed on 0% charge. Fixed an issue where it would remain in-world forever when changing weapon modes.
additional_info: * In VR mode, you can use the Multi-Tool's primary weapon even while the shield is active, but the beam or bolt will be blocked by the shield. This is likely a bug and may be patched in a future update.

title: Personal Refiner
summary:
Personal Refiner is a technology that allows a player to Refine different substances on the move.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit tech inventory slot for it to take effect.

It can be replaced with an upgraded version, the Personal Refiner Mk 2, which can combine two materials instead of only one.
game_description:
A compact extension to the Exosuit, installing a small Portable Refiner, accessible directly from the user's Exosuit interface.

Unit requires fuel and is limited to refining one substance at a time.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene in the Space Anomaly for 360
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a technology.
* Waypoint - Charging requirements changed, now requires 27 Condensed Carbon / 80 Carbon instead of 34/100.
additional_info:
* The Personal Refiner is a central feature in a ongoing exploit when playing in Multiplayer
** To initiate the Exploit, the player must place an item in the refiner that they intend to duplicate
** The player must then exit their Starship on the Space Anomaly, creating an Autosave
** The player must then move the item from the Refiner into their inventory
** The player must then offer an item to another Player, establishing a partial update to their save
** Upon reloading the Autosave, the item(s) removed from the Personal refiner will be in two locations...

title: Personal Refiner Mk 2
summary:
Personal Refiner Mk 2 is a technology that allows a player to refine two different substances on the move.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit tech inventory slot for it to take effect.

It's an upgraded form of the Personal Refiner, allowing refining two materials instead of only one.
game_description:
A compact extension to the Exosuit, installing an advanced yet portable Medium Refiner, accessible directly from the user's Exosuit interface.

Unit requires fuel and is able to refine more complex recipes than the standard personal refiner unit.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene in the Space Anomaly for 580
release_history: * Echoes - Added as a technology.

title: Phase Beam
summary: Phase Beam is one of the primary starship weapons, and is an alternative to the more common Photon Cannon. Both can be used to mine asteroids in space, which hold valuable resources.
game_description:
A high-energy beam weapon for ship-to-ship combat.

Though vulnerable to overheating, these highly accurate laser weapons can recharge the users's shields by leeching energy from target shield systems.

Use () to change weapon mode. Press () to fire.
release_history: * Outlaws - Gained ability to drain enemy starship shields to replenish your ship's shields
additional_info:
* The Phase Beam was featured in various pre-release trailers for ''No Man's Sky'', including the PS4 Explore trailer (see below).
* Phase Beam is one of two starship weapons used by NPC starships (the other one being Photon Cannon).

title: Photonix Core
summary: Photonix Core is a starship technology and upgrade for the Pulse Engine.
game_description: Provides increased manoeuvrability and longer boosts during spaceflight.
source_info:
The blueprint is only available for players who bought the Limited Edition (PS4) version of the game, or got it from the day-one patch.<ref>NMSTheGame Subreddit (3 Nov 2017). [https://www.reddit.com/r/NoMansSkyTheGame/comments/7alibt/photonix_core_and_boltcaster_sm_no_longer_in_game/ Photonix Core and Boltcaster SM no longer in game?]. Reddit. Retrieved 5 July 2019.</ref>

It also comes pre-installed on the Starborn Runner, which is rewarded by completing Expedition 12: Omega, allowing players from other platforms, and new PS4 players, to get a Photonix Core.

If the player starts a run of the Omega expedition from their main save, they can get a second Starborn Runner, and thus a second Photonix Core, by copying it back from the expedition save at the end. To do this, the Starborn Runner, or whatever ship has the Photonix Core installed, must be the current ship in the expedition when ending it.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Chrysonite, Iron and Zinc. Stats changed, previously +25% Pulsedrive Power and +10% Boost were given.
* Omega - A single module comes equipped on the Starborn Runner ship. The module can be unequipped and attached to another ship.

title: Plasmatic Warp Injector
summary: Plasmatic Warp Injector is a level 2 freighter technology and it improves the Freighter Hyperdrive capabilities by increasing the distance that can be traveled by a freighter.
game_description:
An augmentation for the colossal hyperdrive engine of an interstellar freighter.

Hyperdrive benefits from advanced fusion that brings starship to higher warp speed and intensity. User's craft will become able to leap deeper into space, and into more distant planetary systems.
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for eight Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Sodium Diode.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Positron Ejector
summary: Positron Ejector is a weapons technology for the starship. This starship weapon fires 20-shot spreads somewhat rapidly, but lacks the range and cooling of other starship weapons.
game_description:
A powerful starship weapon, capable of delivering extreme destruction at close range.

Note: these particles show decreased effectiveness against shielded targets.

Use () to change weapon mode. Press () to fire.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Fragment Supercharger and procedurally generated Positron Ejector Upgrades added, while Sigma/Tau/Theta upgrades removed. Blueprint changed, formerly used Nickel and Platinum.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, formerly used Technology Module instead of Wiring Loom
additional_info:
* This weapon destroys whatever is directly in front of your ship, but mainly it's a close range weapon. Consider it a "starship shotgun."
**A full 20-shot volley out-damages a Rocket Launcher volley by 20%, but lacks its extremely long range.
* The Positron Ejector is one of the best mining tools. A single burst (from cool to overheating) directed at a large asteroid will give you 200 of the asteroid's material in just a few seconds.
*Positron Ejector's heat status is not properly displayed in the HUD --- the bar that normally shows heat status does not fill up while firing, but the white sliver at its right end turns red when the weapon is close to overheating.
*It heats up very fast, and takes a long time to disperse heat, meaning it's best to not let it overheat, or let it overheat if the heat accumulation is too high, as the cool down speed is much faster than normal recovery, even with high heat dispersion upgrades.

title: Positron Ejector (Atlas)
summary: The Positron Ejector is a weapons component of the starship.
game_description: Shots are granted a wide cone of destruction. With reduced range and rate of fire, users are encouraged to engage their targets in close proximity.
additional_info:
* This upgrade was added to the game as part of the Pathfinder update.
* This weapon destroys whatever is directly in front of your ship, but mainly it's a close range weapon. Consider it a "starship shotgun."
* The Positron Ejector is one of the best mining tools. A single burst (from cool to overheating) directed at a large asteroid will give you 200 of the asteroid's material in just a few seconds.

infobox.desc: Shots are granted a wide cone of destruction.

title: Precision Minotaur Laser
summary: Precision Minotaur Laser is a Minotaur Laser upgrade for Minotaur providing the same abilities as Exocraft Mining Laser Upgrade Sigma.
game_description:
An upgrade for the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid's laser array system.

Amplifies the power deployed by the mining beam, increasing mining speed and enabling the processing of difficult to mine raw materials.
release_history:
* ExoMech - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Cobalt Mirror

title: Pressure Membrane
summary: Pressure Membrane is an Exosuit technology that gives the player improved efficiency and protection in deep water.
game_description:
Extreme pressure environments - such as deep water - cause elevated stress on the Exosuit's oxygen circulation and general life support systems.

Installation of this reinforced pressurisation shell increases efficiency and protection while operating in high-pressure environments.
source_info: This blueprint can be bought from the Exosuit upgrade merchant on the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.

title: Pulsating Core
summary:
Pulsating Core is a curiosity.

It can be obtained at a Korvax Plaque as part of the Starbirth mission.
game_description:
A biomechanical construct, created to the design of an anonymous host.

Organic, but aglow with heat and posessing a highly-pressurised inner vessel. This 'device' is part pump, and part accelerated evolutionary chamber.
source_info: The blueprint is a reward given during the Starbirth mission.
release_history: * Living Ship - Added as a product.

title: Pulse Spitter Ricochet Module
summary:
Pulse Spitter Ricochet Module is projectile technology that augments the Pulse Spitter, a Multi-tool weapon. 

Its effects stack with those provided by Pulse Spitter Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades. A blueprint can be purchased from Iteration: Eos for 180
game_description:
Creates an antimatter field around the shots of the Pulse Spitter, causing them to be repelled by non-damaged surfaces.

Enables ricochet, causing projectiles to bounce if they hit a target they do not damage.
release_history:
* Desolation - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used TetraCobalt.

title: Q-Resonator
summary: Q-Resonator is a technology that uses the Infra-Knife Accelerator icon. It adds two extra shots to each firing of Infra-Knife Accelerator, effectively tripling its base damage output. These extra shots have no effect on the rate at which the Infra-Knife overheats, and it fires volleys just as fast as the base weapon fires individual shots. Supercharging this module has no effect, despite the tooltip increasing to 4; there is no visible added bullet, or increase in damage.
game_description: Upgrades the Infra Knife Accelerator, compressing internal waveforms to allow an extra shot to be weaved in to the conventional fire patterns.
release_history:
*Synthesis - Added as an upgrade technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Destablised Sodium.
additional_info: This upgrade effectively replaces the Nonlinear Optics (Infra-Knife Accelerator) upgrade.

title: Radar Amplifier
summary: Radar Amplifier is a level-1 upgrade to the standard quick menu to scan for additional points of interest, including Abandoned Buildings and Drop Pods without the use of Navigational Charts of any kind.
game_description: Allows for additional building types to be acquired by the Exocraft Radar.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Scan bonus added.
* Beyond - Renamed, formerly Exocraft Signal Booster Upgrade Sigma.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly Advanced Signal Booster.

title: Radar Power Resonator
summary:
Radar Power Resonator is a level-2 upgrade to the standard Exocraft Radar. 

It can be used with the Quick Menu to scan for additional points of interest, including Ruins and Monoliths.
game_description: Allows for additional building types to be acquired by the Exocraft Radar.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Scan bonus added.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly Exocraft Signal Booster Upgrade Tau.

title: Radiation Deflector
game_description:
User is shielded from radiation damage.

Greatly reduces user peril during the exploration of irradiated worlds. Micro-vibrations increase electromagnetic wave reflection, thereby reducing absorption.

Device is charged by mineral extracts found in radioactive environments. Operates automatically once constructed within user's exosuit inventory.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
additional_info: *Works automatically when located in a player's Exosuit inventory

infobox.desc: User is guarded from extreme radiation damage on radioactive worlds.

title: Radiation Protection Upgrade
summary: Radiation Protection Upgrades, contained within Radiation Protection Modules, are upgrades granting supplementary protection against radiation.
additional_info:
*It is not clear as to what percentages of Radiation Protection and Radiation Shielding are given. All that has been observed is that the depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too irradiated or way too irradiated, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat)
**Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold)
**Toxic Protection Upgrades

These only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Reality De-Threader
summary: Reality De-Threader is a level 3 freighter technology and it improves the Freighter Hyperdrive capabilities by increasing the distance that can be traveled by a freighter.
game_description:
An augmentation for the colossal hyperdrive engine of an interstellar freighter.

Uncapped, yet stabilised, fusion systems are threaded into user's hyperdrive. Allows starship to jump ever longer distances in deep space.
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for 12 Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Salt Refractor.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Remembrance
summary:
Remembrance is an exosuit health technology and its blueprint is a reward for finishing The Purge mission in the Artemis Path storyline.

Installing it grants one unit of core health and allows the player to operate Remembrance Terminals placed behind AtlasPass v2 and AtlasPass v3 doors.
game_description: Everything you ever knew is within.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a technology. It has the same icon as Atlas Stone.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Heart of the Sun and Nanite Clusters.
additional_info: This has an adjacency bonus with the Star Seed.

title: Resonance Matrix
summary: Resonance Matrix is a freighter technology that allows warping to purple Star systems.
game_description:
Sideloads a resonant memory packet into your warp computer, allowing the ship to pass through the dissonant space surrounding purple stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint is unlocked via progressing through the In Stellar Multitudes questline, without needing to research it at the Upgrade Control terminal.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a freighter technology.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Rocket Boots
summary:
Rocket Boots is a technology that allows a player to fire their jetpack rapidly in effort to fly a greater distance and increase flight time.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description:
Equips the Exosuit jetpack with advanced jump capabilities, allowing the user to take huge leaps with ease.

Activate jump systems by rapidly pressing 25px/45px/25px (PS4/PC/Xbox).
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant for 200
release_history:
* NEXT 1.60 - Fixed an issue that prevented it from functioning.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Salt Refractor.
additional_info:
*Upgrade bonuses trigger if Rocket Boots are adjacent to Neural Stimulator or Movement System Upgrades, but the technology is not actually affected by these bonuses.
**Rocket Boots does not count toward the three-upgrade limit; however, only one Rocket Boots technology can be installed at a time.

title: Rocket Launcher
summary: Rocket Launcher is a weapons technology for the starship which allows the simultaneous launch of three rockets at enemy ships during dogfights or space battles with pirates. They are not guided and require manually leading your target at longer ranges. To make up for its disadvantage they deal an accumulated damage of 3000 in one attack to all targets in their collective splash radius, making it particularly useful for dealing with clusters of pirates heading towards you. After launching its rockets the weapon needs to cool down before it can be used again.
game_description:
A long range starship weapon, capable of delivering a highly explosive torpedo across massive distances.

Note: explosive damage is highly effective against unshielded targets, but ineffective against shielded targets.

Use () to change weapon mode. Press () to fire.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Large Rocket Tubes upgrade added. Blueprint changed, formerly used Nickel and Platinum.
additional_info: The Rocket Launcher is pre-installed in the starter ship Radiant Pillar BC1 when starting the game.

title: Salvaged Data
summary: Salvaged Data is a Constructed Technology that can be exchanged at the Space Anomaly or
game_description:
The salvageable heart of some ancient technology. Unreadable in its current form.

These databanks can be spent at a Construction Research Unit and used to research new Construction Blueprints.
source_info:
* Found in envoy. (14%)
* Nexus missions (8%)
* Mission Board missions (~4%)
* Missions from the bounty master in outlaw systems. (2%)
* From the Base Computer Archives mission.

<sup>1</sup> It can't be found on dead planets or in uncharted systems.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a curiosity.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Beyond - Renamed from Salvaged Technology to Salvaged Data.
* Expeditions - Value increased, was 50,000.0 units
* Waypoint - Icon changed.
additional_info: * Sources extracted from the 4.06 version of the REWARDTABLE.MBIN game file.

title: Salvaged Frigate Module
summary: Salvaged Frigate Module is a Constructed Technology that can be exchanged at the Upgrade Control terminal for various blueprints.
game_description:
A technology module harvested from the remains of a large interstellar starship. May be collected from freighter crashsites or salvaged during frigate expeditions.

Useless in its current form, a Research Station aboard your freighter may be able to convert it into useable technology.
release_history:
* Outlaws - Altered cargo-pod loot drop tables.
* Waypoint - Icon changed.
additional_info:
* Reward probabilities extracted from the 4.05 version of the EXPEDITIONREWARDTABLE.MBIN and REWARDTABLE.MBIN game files. The chances have been calculated based on the weights in these files.
* As of Endurance up to 78 Salvaged Frigate Modules may be required to unlock all recipes.

title: Salvaged Upgrade Components
summary: Salvaged Upgrade Components, contained within upgrades that grant various bonuses to your Exosuit.
release_history: *Echoes - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Core health units added by Salvaged Upgrade Components start out depleted and will not protect the player from death until they have been replenished by a source of healing.
* Adjacency upgrade bonuses trigger for Salvaged Upgrade Components, Defence Systems Upgrades, and Forbidden Exosuit Modules. If they have common stats they share such as Shield Strength, the stat bonus can be increased above listed values. This does not, however, apply adjacency bonuses to other upgrades such as Life Support technologies or Jetpack technologies, despite sharing some of these stats.
* Note that extra core health granted by these modules may not be a beneficial stat late-game, as it is possible to max out with 9 core health units using only Defence Systems Upgrades, Remembrance, and Star Seed/Mark of the Denier.  Further core health stat bonuses have no effect, so it may be better to choose a different 4th stat to pump.

title: Scatter Blaster
summary:
Scatter Blaster is a technology upgrade for the Multi-tool which uses Projectile Ammunition.

This shotgun-style weapon fires 8 projectiles at once in a wide spread, allowing it to damage multiple targets at once, and making it most effective in close range encounters such as charging animals or attacks by Sentinel Quads.

It has a burst capacity of two shots by default (can be observed by holding down the attack button), which can be upgraded through S and X-rated Scatter Blaster Upgrades.
game_description:
Specialist close combat weapon attachment for the Multi-Tool. Access fire mode by pressing 20px/20px/20px (PS4/PC/Xbox) and fire weapon with 40px/20px/40px (PS4/PC/Xbox).

The Scatter Blaster reconfigures the Multi-Tool to heat and shatter Metallic Elements, firing them in a wide cone of destruction. Range is limited, but the shrapnel is highly effective at close range.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a weapon upgrade
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron and Chrysonite. Shell Greaser and procedurally generated Scatter Blaster Upgrades added, while Sigma/Tau/Theta upgrades removed.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, Technology Module was renamed to Wiring Loom.
additional_info:
* The Scatter Blaster initially can hold 24 projectiles at a time.
* The Damage stat represents the Scatter Blaster's effectiveness against fauna and sentinels; the Mining Power stat represents the weapon's effectiveness against flora and minerals.

title: Science Terminal
summary:
Overseer questline.

The blueprints for the following items can be acquired at a Science Terminal based on specific quests from the Scientist.
game_description: A research station tailored to the needs of Scientists, and equipped for research and development of scientific blueprints.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building product.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron. Voltaic Cell and Weatherproof Rubber replaced by Microprocessor and Large Refiner.
additional_info: * There appears to be a restriction that requires the terminal to be built on the top floor of a structure.  Once the terminal is built, another floor can be put on top of it.

title: Scream Suppressor
summary: Scream Suppressor is the standard means of protecting a Living starship against enemy fire (no collision damage from space objects like asteroids or space stations). It will prevent enemy shots from making contact with the ship, but will regenerate slowly while not fully charged, necessitating manual recharge with Pugneum for meaningful durability extension in combat. If not recharged and permitted to deplete, the suppressor will drop, leaving the starship vulnerable to critical damage.
game_description:
This small extension to the ship's automated defence network appears to be its own autonomous organizm. A small mouth in the centre of its flesh hungers for Pugneum.

During combat, it seems to hijack the neurological array and prevent fear of pain from traumatising the rest of the ship's body.
release_history:
* Living Ship - Added as a technology
* Update 2.32 - Added an ability to evolve for
additional_info: *Upgrade Nodes can be obtained by shooting Void Eggs in uncharted and abandoned systems.

infobox.desc: Prevents fear of pain from trumatising the rest of the ship's body.

title: Seeds of Glass
summary:
Seeds of Glass is a curiosity.

It can be obtained at a Korvax Plaque as part of the Starbirth mission.
game_description:
A biomechanical construct, created to the design of an anonymous host.

Capsules of genetic material, encased in a film of living glass. Shared memories swim in the their
source_info: The blueprint is a reward given during the Starbirth mission.
release_history: * Living Ship - Added as a product.

title: Self-Greasing Servos
summary: Self-Greasing Servos is a fuel economy upgrade for Minotaur.
game_description: An automatically-regulated lubricant dispenser fitted to the leg joints of the Minotaur reduce
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Sentinel Exosuit Fragment
summary: Sentinel Exosuit Fragment is a Consumable that yields a Forbidden Exosuit Module when used.
game_description: An anomalous upgrade for Exosuit. Use (
source_info: Occasionally obtained from Salvaged Glass.
release_history: * Echoes - Added as a consumable.

title: Shell Greaser
summary:
Shell Greaser is a Projectile technology that augments the Scatter Blaster, a Multi-tool weapon. Its effects stack with those provided by Scatter Blaster Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades.

The blueprint can be purchased from Iteration: Eos.
game_description: Advanced self-lubricating components decrease friction within the Scatter Blaster, offering significant improvements to reload times.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Beyond -Source changed, previously could be acquired from a vendor.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Chloride Lattice.

title: Shield Lattice
summary:
Shield Lattice is a technology that increases the Hazard Protection of the exosuit.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description: Increase the base capacity of the Hazard Protection system, allowing the user to spend longer in hazardous environments without recharging their Exosuit.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.53 - The indicated bonus seems to be broken, the duration of the hazard protection is unaffected by this technology. 
* Synthesis 2.23  - Bug from 1.53 has been fixed
* Origins - Formula changed, formerly used Sodium Diode

title: Signal Booster
summary:
Signal Booster is a portable base building product that helps the player to locate structures, and resources and to obtain the Galactic Coordinates of the star system of the planet. 

It is similar to the signal transmitter pole (also known as "save point"). When placed on a planet surface, inside or outside a base in any location, they will display the star system galactic coordinates and provide the user with an interaction menu. Upon interaction the player may choose "Locate Nearby Structures" to locate a random point of interest on the same planet.
game_description:
A versatile scanner that detects nearby buildings. Can decrypt Navigation Data to pinpoint specific locations.

The Signal Booster can be dismantled and redeployed for easy transportation.
release_history:
* bases.
* Foundation - Signal Boosters replaced Signal Scanners as the main structure to aid in planetary navigation. Before this update, Signal Scanners were found on planetary surfaces and had to be unlocked with NEXT 1.57 - Fixed an issue that could cause the "Locate Nearby Structures" scan to fail.
* NEXT 1.63 - Fixed an issue that caused the "Locate Nearby Structures" option to find only buildings of the same type as the nearest building.
* Beyond - Options to select specific Points of Interest removed from the Signal Booster menu.
* Waypoint - Option removed to decipher Drop Pod Coordinate Data.
additional_info:
alt=Signal scanner|thumb|Signal booster closeup (Atlas Rises)
When placed on a coordinates when approached. It looks something like this one from the video below:

title: Simple Translator
summary: Simple Translator technology allows a player to understand alien words more quickly. The additional words are not permanently learned, only understood.
game_description:
An Automatic translation device. It records and parses nearby conversations before running the data through a contextual learning system to determine intended meaning.

Low memory capacity on this entry-level model limits translation capacity.
source_info:
The blueprint can be acquired from Technology Merchants selling Exosuit technologies.
The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a technology.
YOU HAVE TO COMPLETE TOP TIER TRANSLATOR TO GET ARTEMIS TRANSLATOR TO APPEAR IN YOUR INVENTORY. I HAD ALL TIERS AT THE TIME, THEN COMPLETED THE TOP ONE AND THE ARTEMIS TRANSLATOR APPEARED IN MY TECHNOLOGY INVENTORY OF THINGS I COULD COMPLETE IN EXOSUIT.
additional_info:
The "Words Translated" stat operates as follows:

* 1.0-7.0 words total: When all four technologies are installed, you will always get a minimum of one word translated for you up to the highest amount attained, even if the translated words are already learned.

There are several variations of this technology:

* Tier C - Artemis' Translator
* Tier B - Simple Translator
* Tier A - Superior Translator
* Tier S - Advanced Translator

title: Singularity Engine
summary: The Singularity Engine is a freighter technology that generates and warps a freighter through a Black Hole.
game_description:
An unstable and highly-experimental piece of freighter hyperdrive technology. This extreme gravity device generates a wormhole deep within the freighter's reactor core, inverting the entire vessel and transporting it across the universe.

Speak to the freighter's commander to engage the drive. Warning: destination is not controllable.
source_info: *Expedition 8: Polestar Deep Sleep Cruise milestone.
release_history: *Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
Black holes that are generated by this powerful warp augmentation lead to a fixed location, determined by location seed where used. It is similar to those in black hole systems, if used in such a system, one arrives in the same location the black hole leads to.

This upgrade is only available in the normal save where the expedition that introduced the technology was played. This upgrade is not buyable or earnable outside of that expedition save.

However, if one obtains the upgrade outside of the expedition, they can install it on their freighter.

infobox.recharge: Di-hydrogen, Deuterium, Cobalt, Ionised Cobalt, Salt

title: Spawning Sac
summary: Spawning Sacs are a Living Ship Living Ship, serving as the Living Ship equivalent of Storage Augmentation.
game_description:
An additional storage module for Sentient starships. Upon hatching, the parasite inside this sac is grafted upon the vessel, exchanging the use of its cavernous innards for vital nutrients from the host.

Use
source_info: *Brought by Organic Frigates from expeditions.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info: Spawning Sacs share an icon with Seeds of Glass.

title: Star Seed
summary: Star Seed is an exosuit health technology that increases the player's core health by 1 unit.
game_description:
The smallest of sparks, housed within a containment field of unknown origins.

The seed glows with life, desperate to escape and fulfill its potential.
source_info: The blueprint is rewarded for finishing The Atlas Path mission, only if the player chose to birth a star.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a technology. It has the same icon as Hex Core and Hexite.
additional_info:
*As of Living Ship in February 2020, players who previously completed The Atlas Path before Atlas Rises won't automatically get the blueprint for the Star Seed. This means they won't benefit from the increased core health unless they redo The Atlas Path.

*As of Update 5.50 the star seeds installation allows an additional dialogue option in In Stellar Multitudes.

title: Starship scanner technology
summary: The Starship comes with Scanner Technology installed that can determine the qualities of a system or planet. The scanner can be upgraded to scan the wealth or Conflict Level of other systems that the player is not currently located within.

title: Storage Augmentation
summary: Storage Augmentation is a general inventory or technology slot by one up to a limit.
game_description:
A technology module harvested from the remains of a salvaged starship. May also be collected from freighter crash sites or salvaged during frigate expeditions.

Can be used to expand starship storage capacity at the Space Station's Starship Outfitter.
source_info:
* May be received from a Starship Outfitting Terminal from scrapping any starship. Higher class and hauler type starships are more likely to give them.
* Obtained from Frigate expeditions as a rare reward.
* Found at the Crashed Freighter sites.
* Found in Derelict Freighters.
* Obtained from observatory sites.
* In wheelbarrows of harmonic scrap found in Harmonic Camps.
* Reward from the Mission Agent on Space Stations.
* Free at Master status (and above) from some Explorer Guild Envoys.
release_history:
* Leviathan - Name changed, was "Storage Augmentation".
* Waypoint - Icon changed, name changed, was "Starship Storage Augmentation".
additional_info: * It is recommended to use these after buying starship inventory slots with units. Should you ever want to buy slots with units, each upgrade increases the  upgrade cost with later upgrades having larger increases.

title: Sub-Light Amplifier
summary: Sub-Light Amplifier is a starship technology that increases Pulse Engine speed.
game_description:
A highly advanced upgrade for the Pulse Engine, vastly increasing interplanetary speed.

Naturally occuring frameshift effects within the Pulse Engine are amplified by tritium-based resonators, increasing its maximum sub-light speed.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion on board Space Anomaly for 460
release_history: * Interceptor - Sentinel starships disallow the upgrade from being installed.
additional_info:
* Gives a bonus to the speed and maneuverability if the upgrade is installed next to the Pulse Engine or other Pulse Engine Upgrades.
* All Sentinel starships reject this upgrade with the message: "Aeron Protocol rejects alien Technology".

title: Superior Translator
summary: Superior Translator technology allows a player to understand alien words more quickly. The additional words are not permanently learned, only understood.
game_description:
An Automatic translation device. It records and parses nearby conversations before running the data through a contextual learning system to determine intended meaning.

Parallel language processors enable a greater proportion of recorded speech to be translated.
source_info:
The blueprint can be acquired from Technology Merchants selling Exosuit technologies.
The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Sodium Diode.
additional_info:
The "Words Translated" stat operates as follows:

* 1.0-7.0 words total: When all four technologies are installed, you will always get a minimum of one word translated for you up to the highest amount attained, even if the translated words are already learned.

There are several variations of this technology:

* Tier C - Artemis' Translator
* Tier B - Simple Translator
* Tier A - Superior Translator
* Tier S - Advanced Translator

title: Survey Device
summary: Survey Device is a Multi-tool technology and an upgrade to the Analysis Visor. It enables the Surveying Mode, a real-time terrain analysis to the scanning array.
game_description:
A self-contained circuitry upgrade for the Analysis Visor, adding real-time analysis to the scanning array.

Toggle between Visor mode with 1/3. Use Surveying Mode to detect hidden terrain resources.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Eos on the Space Anomaly for 320 Nanites.

release_history:
*Beyond - Added as new technology.
*Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Sodium Diode and Cobalt Mirror.
additional_info:
*Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
*When placed adjacent to the Analysis Sensor or other Scanner technologies, the player will receive additional scanning bonuses, although not to the Survey Device itself.
*Building this upgrade is also one of the steps of the secondary mission Industrial Surveying
*It is possible to locate the direction of hotspot from a distance more than 400u (This requires listening to the in-game sounds for the "ringing". When this ringing can be heard in both ears you are facing towards the hotspot)

title: Suspicious Packet (Arms)
summary: Suspicious Packet (Arms) is a curiosity. It gives one weapon-related Suspicious Module when opened.
game_description:
A suspicious looking parcel, acquired via an unusual transaction. The seller indicated it contained some sort of weapon-based technology.

Select in the Inventory (40px/40px/30px (PC/PS/XB)) and use 20px/25px/25px (PC/PS/XB) to examine the contents. No refunds.
use_info: Open with 20px/25px/25px (PC/PS/XB) key to receive a random Suspicious Module.
release_history:
* Origins - Added as a curiosity.
* Outlaws - Pirate systems introduced as a source.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Suspicious Packet (Weaponry)".
additional_info: * Contents extracted from the 3.75 version of the REWARDTABLE.MBIN game file.

Select in the Inventory (40px/40px/30px (PC/PS/XB)) and use 20px/25px/25px (PC/PS/XB) to examine the contents. No refunds.

summary: Suspicious Packet (Tech) is a scrap dealer or for ~74,000
game_description:
A suspicious looking parcel, acquired via an unusual transaction. The seller indicated it contained some sort of high-value or interesting item.

Select in the Inventory (40px/40px/30px (PC/PS/XB)) and use 20px/25px/25px (PC/PS/XB) to examine the contents. No refunds.

title: Technology
summary:
Technology is an item that upgrades a player's blueprints.

When installing and upgrading technology, there are specific domains that can be upgraded. Your current stats are shown on the right hand side of the panel of your multi-tool or starship (stats for the exosuit are not displayed in-game).
* In starships, you upgrade Damage Potential, Shield Absorb, Hyperdrive Range, and Maneuverability.
* For Multi-tools, you upgrade Damage Potential and Scanner Range.
* For the Exosuit you can upgrade Life Support, Hazard Protection, Movement, and Gloves.

How to use technologies:
# Loot, buy or otherwise learn blueprints.
# Craft Technologies and install them into slots (general slots or technology slots).
# Optionally buy Upgrade Modules and install them.
# If needed, dismantle Technologies and re-craft them in a different slot.

title: Technology (Atlas)
summary:
thumb|Inventory page for a ship
There are four basic upgrade levels, labeled by Greek letters. In order of improvement they are:
* SIGMA
* TAU
* THETA
* OMEGA

Note that very few of the technologies have an OMEGA version of improvement.

When upgrading technology, there are twelve specific areas that can be upgraded. These are shown on the right hand side of three separate upgrade panels (exosuit, multi-tool, and starship).

Each icon has a number of rings surrounding it. As upgrades to that particular area of technology are made, the rings are filled in to indicate the current status level. Note that in the graphic, the Weapons icon has two circles partially filled in, corresponding to the Phase Beam and Photon Cannon. On the other hand, the Hyperdrive icon has one circle, representing a completed Hyperdrive.

title: Teleport Receiver
summary: Teleport Receiver is a starship technology, which increases ship material teleport range from 50u to 150u.
game_description:
A device that modulates standard starship communication signals to enable the transport of matter as well as data.

Starships fitted with such a device can send and receive products and substances to a user's exosuit over a long distance.
additional_info:
The Teleport Receiver is a ship upgrade that once installed allows moving items to and from your ship from a longer range.  

Default max 50u, with this upgrade max 150u. Thus tripling the distance, and the effective area coverage times 9 (Pi * radius<sup>2</sup>).  

In practice this means you can now often reach the ship from anywhere in a base or Trade Outpost etc. and not just when right next to it.

title: Temporal Warp Computer
summary: Temporal Warp Computer is a freighter technology that allows warping to blue Star systems.
game_description:
Upgrades the hyperdrive's computational matrix, preventing temporal anomalies when attempting to reach rare-class blue stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for 12 Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used TetraCobalt.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Tethys Beam
summary:
Tethys Beam is a variant of the Exocraft Mining Laser that can only be mounted on the Nautilon. 

Its internal fuel supply can be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit).

It is not a pre-installed technology and needs a blueprint to build it.
game_description:
A mounted laser system specifically designed for the Nautilon Submarine.

Fires a concentrated plasma beam towards the intended target, which is then ignited. Such a trigger mechanism allows the use of high-energy optical mining systems in a liquid medium.
source_info: The blueprint is acquired from Exocraft Technology Merchants.
additional_info: * The Tethys Beam can, under the right conditions, be used to mine Resource Deposits that are above water (they do not currently appear to spawn underwater). For this to work, the Nautilon must still be submerged or else the laser's reticle cannot be aimed higher than sea level.

title: Thermal Buffer
summary: Thermal Buffer is a hazard protection upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description: Sublimation cooling vents and high-thermal mass buffers are installed in all structural panels, keeping the Exocraft pilot at non-lethal temperatures even in the most overwhelming of firestorms.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology

title: Thermal Protection Upgrade (Cold)
summary: Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold), contained within Thermal Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary protection against low temperatures.
additional_info:
*It is not clear as to what percentages of Cold Protection and Cold Shielding are given. All that has been observed is that the depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too cold or way too cold, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat)
**Toxic Protection Upgrades

These only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Thermal Protection Upgrade (Heat)
summary: Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat), contained within Thermal Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary protection against high temperatures.
additional_info:
*It is not clear as to what percentages of Heat Protection and Heat Shielding are given. All that has been observed is that the depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too hot or way too hot, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold) or Toxic Protection Upgrades, though these only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Thermic Layer
summary:
User is guarded from extreme cold damage on frozen worlds.

Heat capillaries threaded through a user's suit that evenly distributes liquid calidium to maintain a comfortable body temperature.

The device operates automatically once constructed within user's exosuit inventory and does not require recharging.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Origins - No longer requires recharging elements such as Dioxite, Ion Battery, or Advanced Ion Battery

Category:Exosuit
Category:Thermic Layer

ja:
Category:Blueprints
additional_info:
*Works automatically when located in a player's Exosuit inventory
*Increases cold resistance by 21%

infobox.desc: User is guarded from extreme cold damage on frozen worlds.

title: Toxic Protection Upgrade
summary: Toxic Protection Upgrades, contained within Toxic Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary protection against toxins.
release_history: *Origins - Advanced Ion battery removed from game. Regular ion battery now recharges 100%
additional_info:
*The depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too corrosive or way too corrosive, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat)
**Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold)
**Radiation Protection Upgrades
These only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Toxin Suppressor
summary: User with a toxin suppressor installed will have some protection from toxic damage that may be inflicted by the atmospheric environment on
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Removed from the game. If it was installed, it has turned into Obsolete Technology.
* Crossplay - Brought back into the game with a different description and formula
additional_info: * Works automatically when located in a player's Exosuit inventory

title: Trade Rocket
summary:
Trade Rocket is a technology that allows a player to sell Trade Goods from the planet surface.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description: A personal rocketry device with a direct link to the Galactic Trade Network. This unit allows the user to load a small spacecraft with goods. Upon launch, the goods will be transported to the nearest trade terminus and automatically sold.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene in the Space Anomaly for 90
release_history: * Waypoint - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Trade Rocket has 25 slots.
* It requires tritium to operate.
* Be careful however, the Rocket does not trade for nanites, so pay attention, otherwise you will waste nanite related items like sentinel upgrades.
* Units are credited instantly after pressing the launch button.
* It can be followed after launch, and flies at normal (non-boost, non-Pulse Drive) speeds in the direction of the Space Station. It is invulnerable to damage, but can damage your ship's shields if it flies into you.

title: Voltaic Amplifier
summary: The Voltaic Amplifier is a general Multi-tool upgrade for all multi-tool weapons.
game_description:
A generalised upgrade for all Multi-Tool weapon systems, causing its projectiles to resonate dramatically upon impact with any appropriate electromagnetic field.

Will significantly increase the damage dealt to any organic and inorganic entities that are currently stunned.

Stats: Damage stunned entities +21%
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired in the Space Anomaly for 180
release_history: *SentinelUp - added as a technology

title: Warp Core Resonator
summary: Warp Core Resonator is a level 1 freighter technology and it improves the Freighter Hyperdrive capabilities by increasing the distance that can be traveled by a freighter.
game_description:
An augmentation for the colossal hyperdrive engine of an interstellar freighter.

Quantum resonation
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for four Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Oxygen Filter.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Waveform Oscillator
summary:
Waveform Oscillator is a Multi-tool upgrade which applies a brief stunning effect to any target hit by the Javelin's beam. The stun is of the same duration regardless of the Javelin's charge level. The blueprint can be purchased in Space Anomaly.

Waveform Oscillator needs to be crafted and then stored in a Multi-tool inventory slot for it to have its effect. Unlike Blaze Javelin Upgrades, this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for enhancing Upgrade bonuses on other upgrades.
game_description:
Overloads the energy beam generated by the Blaze Javelin, causing it to deliver a power electrical charge at its poin of impact.

Will briefly stun any organic and inorganic entities that intersect the Blaze Javelin's beam.
release_history: * SentinelUp - added as a technology upgrade

title: Waveform Recycler
summary:
Waveform Recycler is a technology that increases the scan radius and decreases the recharge time of the Scanner. 

It needs to be installed in a Multi-tool inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description:
A powerful lateral processor inserted into the Multi-Tool Scanning System allows the device to recharge at a significantly improved rate.

Increase potential scan frequency.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant for 120

title: Weapons Terminal
summary:
The Weapons Terminal is used for weaponry and explosives. It is used by a hired NPC known as an Armourer. These NPCs can be recruited in space stations within Vy'keen controlled systems.

The blueprints for the following items can be acquired at a Weapons Terminal based on specific quests from the Armourer.

* Haz-Mat Gauntlet
* Cyclotron Ballista
* Advanced Mining Laser
* Positron Ejector
* Infra-Knife Accelerator
game_description:
thumb|right|Weapons terminal
A research station tailored to the needs of Armourers, and equipped for the development of munitions and explosives as well as selected civilian tech.
release_history:
*Foundation - added as a type of terminal
*Beyond - formula changed, had been 50 Iron
*Crossplay - formula changed, had been 25 Magnetised Ferrite
additional_info:
* It can be built in a Cylindrical Room or a Square Room.
* The multitool can be up to S class
* You can re-roll which multitool you get by changing systems. Can be done quickly with a freighter that has the Weapons Terminal built on it. By changing systems, you can improve the class by one level, as some systems will give you a slightly better multitool than others.

title: Wormhole Brain
summary:
Wormhole Brain is a Living Ship technology and allows the player to check a star system's economy and conflict status in the Galactic Map without having to warp to that system.

Essentially, the Wormhole Brain serves as the equivalent of a regular Starship's Conflict Scanner and Economy Scanner, fused into one item and adjusted for Living Ships.
game_description:
The wormhole brain permits the ship vision of systems far beyond its own experience. It consists of strands of neural matter, wrapped around a micro-singularity and tethered directly to the ship's visual cortex.

Detailed economic and conflict data will become available on the Galaxy Map, should the ship permit it.
source_info: Grown from a Wormhole Brain Implant.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info: The Wormhole Brain shares an icon with the Growing Singularity.

infobox.desc: Grants the remote ability to check a system's economy and conflict
